title: An Oceanfront Property in Fiji With a Nod to Traditional Architecture
text:
Listing of the Day

Location: Denarau Island, Fiji

Price: FJ$24,144,450 (US$11 million)

Standing on the western tip of Fiji’s Viti Levu island, facing the South Pacific, this new-build contemporary house is a tropical island escape.

It’s on Denarau, an integrated coastal resort with upscale hotels set on a manmade island. West-facing and positioned on a peninsular, it has horizon, island and coastline views and is surrounded by water on three sides.

Formed of six thatched pavilions, with sandstone walls and artisan-made timber finishes, it mixes traditional architecture with contemporary design. Tall thatched roofs and vaulted ceilings pay homage to indigenous Fijian homes known as bure.

Glazed doors in the property open onto terraces and the gardens beyond, which surround it in greenery. The palm tree-dotted lawn gardens, fire pit, skate ramp, oceanfront decking and solar heated swimming pool have dramatic coastal scenery as their backdrop.

"This private retreat, elegantly designed to reflect the harmony of Fiji’s landscape while featuring contemporary luxury features, is the perfect escape to invite friends to or take the family and enjoy life at it’s very best," said listing agent Ken Jacobs, managing director at Ken Jacobs, Christie’s International Real Estate.

More: Fiji Entices Buyers From the U.S.

Stats

The oceanfront plot the property sits on extends to 41,742 square feet. The property itself (including covered outdoor areas) measures 14,272 square feet.

Custom built in 2018, it has six bedrooms and eight bathrooms, a living room with a chef’s kitchen, a kitchen island and a scullery, staff quarters, and a media room and study, which add further living space.

The property has space for six cars as well as garages.

Amenities

The property comes with its own ramp for a 30-foot boat or seaplane and a marina berth for an 80-foot boat. Having two moorings allows for easy exploration of Fiji’s islands and surrounding waters and reefs by boat.

A chef, gardeners and a housekeeper are available.

More: A Guide to the Season’s New Developments

Neighborhood Notes

Developed in the 1960s, Denarau was built on mangrove swampland is linked to Viti Levu via a causeway.

High-end dining options are available on the resort, which features hotels by Hilton, Sheraton, Sofitel and Radisson Blu.

Denarau Golf & Racquet Club, meanwhile, offers sports facilities, and the world-class surfing spots of Tavarua and Cloudbreak are just under 30 minutes away.

Denarau is less than six miles from Nadi, a large conurbation on Viti Levu with an international airport.
